document.masterDocTitle: Notes on the Homoneura (Homoneura) beckeri group from the Oriental Region, with descriptions of ten new species from China (Diptera: Lauxaniidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on the Homoneura (Homoneura) beckeri group from the Oriental Region, with descriptions of ten new species from China (Diptera: Lauxaniidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to all species of the
beckeri
group in Oriental Region

subSubSection.paragraph:
(females of
H. ( H .) columnaria
,
H. ( H .) convergens
,
H. ( H .) nigritarsis
,
H. ( H .) yinggeling
, and
H. ( H .) zhangae
are unknown)

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Abdominal tergites 1–5 entirely black or at least tergites 1–2 entirely black; tarsomere 5 not black .......................... 2

- Abdominal tergites 1–5 mostly yellow each with a brown triangular median spot and a narrow transverse band on hind margin; tarsomere 5 at least black or blackish brown on apical 1 / 3 .................................................................... 4

2 . Upper half of occiput with a large brown spot on each side, extending to top margin of eye; abdominal tergites 1–2 entirely black and tergite 3 mostly black except narrow yellow anterior margin, tergites 4–5 black on posterior 1 / 2 and yellow on anterior 1 / 2 ; aedeagus with a pair of falciform dorsal sclerites in ventral view (
Fig. 45
) ......................
............................................................................................................................................. H.
( H .) occipitalis Malloch

- Upper half of occiput usually without large brown spot on each side, but if brown spot present it does not extend to top margin of eye; abdominal tergites 1–5 entirely deep black; aedeagus not as above .............................................. 3

3 . Face mostly black except a yellow spot near ventral margin; abdominal tergite 6 black without spot; aedeagus acuate apically without lateral processes in ventral view
......................................................... H.
( H .) bomiensis Gao & Yang

- Face yellow with a pair of black spots; abdominal tergite 6 yellow with distinct brown median spot; aedeagus blunt with a pair of acuate lateral processes in ventral view................................................
H. ( H .) immaculata
(de Meijere)
5 . Face with one transverse band or two horizontal spots on ventral 1 / 3 or near ventral margin .................................... 6

6 . Antennal 1 st flagellomere yellow except dark at tip; hypandrium slightly concave at middle; aedeagus with many apical teeth and a pair of acuate lateral processes in ventral view..........................................
H. ( H .) beckeri (Kertész)

- Antennal 1 st flagellomere entirely black; hypandrium projecting at middle; aedeagus with a few apical teeth but no acuate lateral processes in ventral view ...........................................................
H. ( H .) nigrantennata Yang, Hu & Zhu

7 . Abdominal tergite 5 with a triangular median spot confluent with a blackish brown transverse posterior band; protandrium without ventral process (
Fig. 19
); aedeagus with a pair of acuate lateral processes and a pair of furcated dorsoapical processes constricted subapically in ventral view (
Fig. 20
)
.......................... H.
( H .) columnaria
sp. nov.

- Abdominal tergite 5 with a triangular median spot but no blackish brown transverse band; protandrium with a ventral process (
Fig. 24
); aedeagus consisting of a basal anterior sclerite with a pair of triangular lateral processes, a pair of basally furcated dorsal sclerites convergent at middle and a pair of hammer-like dorsal processes in ventral view (
Fig. 25
)...............................................................................................................................
H. ( H .) convergens
sp. nov.

9 . Antennal 1 st flagellomere brownish yellow; aedeagus with a pair of acuate lateral processes, a pair of incurved horn–like apical processes in ventral view (
Fig. 60
)
...................................................... H.
( H .) yinggelingica
sp. nov.

10 . Mesoscutum with brown stripes; tergite 6 with a small brown median spot; surstylus with a knife-like process in lateral view (
Fig. 27
); aedeagus with a pair of acuate triangular ventral processes and a pair of subuliform dorsal processes in ventral view (
Fig. 30
)
.................................................................................................. H.
( H .) flavida
sp. nov.

- Mesoscutum without brown stripes; tergite 6 without spot; surstylus consisting of a broad hairy digitiform process and a narrow curved bar-like process in lateral view (
Fig. 52
); aedeagus with a pair of acuate lateral processes and a pair of wide S–shaped and furcated dorsoapical processes in ventral view (
Fig. 55
)
....... H.
( H .) tortifurcata
sp. nov.

12 . Abdominal tergite 6 without brown spot; hypandrium with a pair of short bar–like ventral process, aedeagus with a pair of dorsoapical teeth (
Figs. 15–16
) ................................................................................
H. ( H .) apicomata
sp. nov.
- Abdominal tergite 6 with a brown median spot; hypandrium and aedeagus not as above......................................... 13
- Tarsomere 5 partly or entirely brown to black; surstylus not undulating ................................................................... 14

14 . Tarsomere 5 brownish black; surstylus only with a stick–like process, slightly curved and narrow apically (
Fig. 37
); aedeagus with a pair of curved subuliform processes, a pair of acuate lateral processes and a pair of dorsal teeth on dorsal sclerites (
Figs. 40–41
)
............................................................................................... H.
( H .) nigritarsis
sp. nov.

- Tarsomere 5 brown on apical 1 / 2 ; surstylus consisting of a small subuliform process and a digitifom process; aedeagus with pairs of small acuate processes or teeth on dorsal sclerites ......................................................................... 15

15 . Protandrium with a long T–shaped ventral process (
Fig. 34
); aedeagal with dorsal sclerites contorted in lateral view (
Fig. 36
)
.................................................................................................................................. H.
( H .) latissima
sp. nov.

- Protandrium without long T–shaped ventral process; aedeagal with dorsal sclerites straight in lateral view ..............
................................................................................................................................ H.
( H .) yunnanensis Li, Li & Yang

16 . Abdominal tergites 3–5 each with an entirely blackish brown posterior band and triangular median spots, and a triangular median spot confluent with a blackish brown posterior band; surstylus short claw–like, not projecting beyond tip of epandrium in lateral view; hypandrium without lobate ventral sclerites in ventral view; aedeagus with bifurcated sclerite ventrally and two pairs of spine–like processes on dorsal and ventral membranous parts (see
Sasakawa, 1992
: 173 , fig. 19 )
............................................................................................ H.
( H .) fasciventris Malloch

- Abdominal tergites 3–5 each with a black median spot and a pair of black lateral bands; surstylus long knife–like, projecting beyond tip of epandrium in lateral view (
Fig. 62
); hypandrium with a pair of lobate ventral sclerites in ventral view; aedeagus obliquely truncate at tip with a small acuate process (
Figs. 65–66
).
H. ( H .) zhangae
sp. nov.
